abstract.locale: Implements UI capturing functionality by forwarding UI events.

description.locale: A Boolean that specifies capture mode.
Sets the mouse capture to the object that belongs to the current document.
Removes mouse capture from the object in the current document.

Sets element in a modal state if it is not yet modal, otherwise throws exception. UI Events originated outside this element get supressed, except for one capture that is fired upon a click outside modal area. If there was an element set in modal state before, it will pushed to the stack of modals.

Brings element to a normal (non-modal) state if it was set to modal before, otherwise throws exception. In case there was another element set in modal mode before the one being released, it will regain modal state.
Fires when the object is losing the mouse capture.
Fires when user clicks outside either an element set as modal or to receive capture.
